Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh ho! Look who's back reporting for duty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey guys!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam! Ahh! Look what I can do now that she's no longer pregnant. [pretends to punch Pam in the stomach] Bam! Bam! Bam! Bam!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you glad to be back?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, I mean I could have used another week, or three.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You still had eight weeks more than we did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] Well, it's not exactly a vacation.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hello everyone! Remember little old me. Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing here? You just had our baby. Our collective Dunder Mifflin...family baby. Four days ago.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wanted to come back to work. Not everybody needs some long luxurious Parisian maternity leave. [removes coat]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Damn girl! Your body!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, you look amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really? I feel like this big rhinoceros. Anyway, I wanted to thank you guys for covering for me so I made some treats. I've got brownies and magic cookie bars.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: [murmurs of delight as people shuffle toward the treats]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh Angela, those brownies have walnuts in them and I think Kevin's allergic to walnuts. You're allergic to walnuts, right Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Extremely, but I'm gonna fight through it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw. It's OK Angela. I have mommy brain too.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know what that is, Pam. I made a batch with no nuts, special for you Kevin, right here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When did you find time to do all this?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Babies sleep a lot Pam, if you feed them enough. Brownie Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. [takes bite] Oh my gosh. It's really good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wouldn't know, I'm watching my weight. Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So you guys, you know what's an even more useful treat...is cash. So-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. It's over.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...we wanted to say thank you-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight, I have exciting news for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think you're going to like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't tantalize me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oooh, maybe I can. [slowly] I got an email... from corporate....that told me that...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK. [looks at watch and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That...[quickly] you got a promotion! [Dwight turns back] Right? I mean that's not the kinda thing you wanna read quietly at your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you make me head of sales one more time, I swear.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, this is legit. You will be assembling a team to go to Tallahassee for three weeks to develop and launch a chain of Sabre stores.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes, yes, yes, hi-yes! Yeah yeah yeah yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Shrutes have a word for when everything comes together in a man's life perfectly: Perfectinschlag. Hmm. Right now, I am in it. I finally get a chance to prove myself to corporate, I am assembling a competent team, I am likely a father, I am so deep inside of perfectinschlag right now. And just to be clear, there is a second definition, "perfect pork anus" which I don't mean.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And here's the fax for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And here's some facts for you. Did you know frogs can hear with their lungs? And that flamingos can have orgasms that last 30 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ah! Love to learn.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's weird that I said that last one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So... [points out their matching heart pins]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh yeah, look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We're pin twins.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pin twins! This is a gift from Jessica, kind of a gag gift really. Real gifts come later.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. That's cute. When I saw it in CVS it made me gag too. [Andy laughs, walks away, Erin throws away her pin]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: For a while there I thought something would change. But nope. Andy's still with Jessica, they even carpool together most days. I don't know, I wouldn't mind carpooling every day with Andy, but I wouldn't want to spend that much time with Jessica.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What do we have here?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Val knit me a beanie. But I can't if it's a "we're just friends" beanie or a "I'm hot, you're hot, let's get it poppin'" beanie. So I'm gonna up the ante, give her a clearly romantic gift, and we'll get to the meaning of the beanie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, pack up your post-natal swimwear, make it a one piece or this offer is rescinded, and join me on a fantastic barbeque one week from today in Tallahassee, Florida where I'm going to be living for the next three weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm hm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll fly anywhere for some good barbeque.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, me three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eh! No plus one's. This is for competent workers only. And don't worry about the cost, Sabre is footing the bill.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Does this have anything to do with what you were talking to Andy about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God, you're such a spy.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Notice anything different about me?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: You're wearing the beanie. You like it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Super comfortable. Like sweatpants for my head.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: I love it too Val. It's it's really itchy, uh but to be fair my head is constantly itching so I can't really peg it on the hat.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [noticing all the warehouse workers wearing homemade beanies] Wow. It's like the nation of Islam down here.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: I like to knit, don't hate. And who's that for?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, this is a gift, for....my man Nate here.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Darryl, you shouldn't have.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Can I open it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Maybe just later.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Ah, I can't wait. I'm sorry. I get too excited. [opens gift] Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Wow. Those are really nice.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: They're so elegant.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Cashmere.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: How'd you know?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Just a hunch. Your gift is on the way.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Can't wait.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: [reading card] "I'm glad you're in my life. Happy Valentine's Day." Ugh, Darryl. I am glad to be in your life too. Oh, your card is more beautiful than the gloves.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My first task as special project manager Dwight Shrute? Assembling a crack team. I need people who are loyal. People who'll help me get an inroad with the gay Hispanic community. People who won't be missed. We don't need idiots, good for nothing's, methheads or... What's your name?

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: Kathy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kathy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just got a text from Robert California that says "bring your clubs to Florida".

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why? Does he think you're going to Florida?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I hope not. [laughs] Because I am not going. Two question marks?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, just do one. Two question marks is kind of aggressive. You know it's like wha-what?? Just do one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You wanna take Darryl, Phyllis, Toby, Angela and Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can I interest you in someone less essential? Like uh a Creed or a Meredith perhaps?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They're not expendable exactly, I just can't...I can't think of the word I'm trying to find.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?! I'm supposed to get in an airplane with those nincompoops? We'd never get off the runway.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, look. I gotta keep this office functioning somehow. So, I have put together a list, here's your team. Darryl and Phyllis you can have, but you're also taking Kathy, Kelly and Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You have your team.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin!? Kelly!? Kathy!? Andy just gave me a chain with three weak links. Have you ever tried to use a chain with three weak links? I have. And now I no longer own an arctic wolf.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, let's hear it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "Robert, Hey!" Exclamation point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like it so far.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "Got your text, awesome idea. Let's hit the links next time you're in PA" Dash JH.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's perfect. You emphasized the golf, completely omit the Florida.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's a golf text.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Total golf text. Send it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Duh- Wait. I just feel weird. I should just call him.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You wanna call someone? That texted you!? Do you wanna drive them away? I mean, ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [on phone] This is Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry I asked for the main shipping number. I just need the address for the warehouse? I want to send my girlfriend some flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Your girlfriend? Is your girlfriend Val?

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Yeah, do you know her?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We're friends. We're friends.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Cool. Um, so can I get that address or...?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah sorry, I'm just looking for a pen.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Why do you need a pen?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Back off! I got my reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: May I have your attention please? Could Kathy, Darryl, Phyllis, Kevin and Kelly please join me in the conference room immediately?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no big deal. It's just that you five have been deemed most deserving of a three week all expenses paid business trip to Tallahassee, Florida.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hell yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry Stanley, I can't share any more details with you. You see, Andy rejected you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wait. Kathy gets to go? Uh, why does she even still work here? Pam is back.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It just feels like a slap in the face.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can understand your pain and your rage, but you know what? Andy is an honorable man, let us not question his choices. I'm sure he had his reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We're not questioning his reasons. I just wanna know what they are.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know, you and me both, brother. It seemed kinda random to me, but he was pretty clear on who he thought truly deserved this boondoggle of a lifetime.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, he nailed it because I do deserve a vacation. Sometimes Batman's gotta take off his cape.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good point. But we're gonna be working pretty hard until five PM. After that it's gonna be beach volleyball, trips to Cape Canaveral, and sea kayaking with Gloria Estefan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What are the criteria for going?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It might be innate goodness versus innate badness? But there's an easy way to find out. [knocks on Andy's office door] Oh Andy, gotta few questions for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mooshie mooshie. [Dwight laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, the Florida picks got out, and people were just kind of curious as to why they weren't picked and maybe you could just clarify?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well uh...well the deliberations were confidential so...I feel like we should respect that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Respect it? You're trying to tell me Kevin Malone deserves more than Stanley Hudson.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ok, it's obvious Andy picked the people that are least important to the office.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Important? Oh because you and your enormous monster baby are so important to the branch.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My baby is not a monster!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Be proud of your enormous monster baby. I was once an enormous monster baby.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys. Guys. Guys. Come on, seriously? We cannot let this trip cause this kind of rift, guys!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Stop calling us "guys".

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I use the word "guys" a lot when I'm nervous...guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys! Guys! Guys!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys..

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Stop. Stop it Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: ...Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dudes...the dudes who are going to Florida were picked by Dwight and me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK hey. I specifically remember there were a lot of other people I thought should be considered.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wha-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If anybody's going to Florida, it should be me. Every shirt I have that isn't a work shirt is a Tommy Bahama. I'm the only person in this office who watches Burn Notice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK, I did not realize that so many of you wanted to go so badly, so if you feel like you have a very good reason to go to Florida, I'm happy to hear you out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great idea! So why doesn't everyone just take the next five to six hours, come up with a statement on why you feel you deserve to go to Florida and Andy and I will listen to it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. That is a ridiculous waste of time.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: For you maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Five to six hours?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Three to four hours.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No no no no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Two to three hours...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come up with a statement in the next hour....

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thirty minutes!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, read it back to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reading text] Robert, great offer. Wish I could hit the links with you in Florida but a father of a newborn really should be helping out his wife any chance he gets.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good. Doesn't sound pushy...you're just stating a fact.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Absolutely. Works for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, sending.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well done. And we managed to kill the entire morning.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really did [Text bleep] He responded L-O-L.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughs exaggeratedly]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have a new swimsuit I need to break in....

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I am...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have already picked my team: Darryl, Oscar, Angela, Phyllis and Toby and that is the team that I am taking. What's that? It's not up to me? I only have influence? Well, that's all Baltzer Gladfielder had and no one eats owls for Thanksgiving.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You have two young dynamic people in this office who know trends, who know youth. That's myself and Kelly Kapoor, you need one of us there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Or both?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Not both. Just one, me. Or if not me, Kelly. Ideally me. Again, youth knowledge. That's what you get when you put Ryan Howard on your special project team...or Kelly Kapoor. Again, not both. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Very impressive. He put a lot of work into that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hm. Powerpoints are the peacocks of the business world. All show, no meat.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Because I feel like that I'm in a place with my gambling rehab that I can finally start going to dog racing again. You know, just sitting, watching, enjoying the sport? Maybe putting down a few dollars if there's like a crazy mismatch or something...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. Thank you Kevin, we'll let you know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When do we leave?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It has been a long, lonely winter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow. Seasonal effective disorder, AKA: sad. That sounds like a very real thing, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It is real, thank you for saying that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, wow. It's almost like we're not all experiencing the same winter?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Florida Stanley smiles. Florida Stanley is happy to go to work. Florida Stanley is who you want on your Florida team.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe it's what she does here...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey guys, any spots left?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin, you wanna go to Tallahassee?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I do. I really do. I think it would be a nice way to clear my head.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know I don't think it's a good idea for you to clear your head any more than it has been already. I think you need a workplace where the burdens of everyday life keep you tethered to reality.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Either or. But if you can find someone to fill in, I would love to go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well it wouldn't be hard to find someone to fill in..

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really? Oh, great. Good, ahem, good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now, is it too dark to say that Cici's having an operation?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think you need to go to Florida.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you're right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's only for three weeks, you know with my mom and sister at the house it'll be..

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Total nightmare.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was going to say good because I'll have all the help I need?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's what I'm saying. They're incredibly helpful, you're lucky to have them. I mean with them there, you probably won't even know I'm gone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, [Jim enters] No! No! Absolutely not! You are not going. Over my dead body, no. Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuns, I'm really sorry. You're too essential to the operation here, I can't let you go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wouldn't say that...it's a bit much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know Dwight, if you didn't want me to go the smart move would be to tell Andy that I actually am essential to the operation. That way I couldn't go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim is essential to th-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hold on, just wanna get it on camera. [holds up cellphone]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy, Jim is just too...essen-...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Essential.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is stupid! Cut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, I'm gonna pack my trunks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He doesn't even want to go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I got a text from RC inviting me to come down so I think that's gonna make us roomates.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, quick question: Do you shower at night or in the morning? Cause I wanna shower when you're showering. Save some water.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK, listen up everyone, here's who's going to Florida: Kathy..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ....Stanley..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...Ryan...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...Erin...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: (Bleep)

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...And, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've gotta be (bleep)-ing kidding me. Ok. Ok, Florida group, welcome to the team. [goes into conference room and slams door] AHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go, step it up you runts. You infants, let's move.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why is it so hot in here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hot? What are you talking about? This is a nice temperate Florida morning. Eighty-five degrees, seventy-five percent humidity. This is the exact environment you will be facing for the next three weeks of your life. Welcome to special projects orientation. The next three weeks of your life are gonna be the most miserable you've ever faced. They're gonna be hard, they're gonna be dirty. You're gonna wish you were dead.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: But...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But? There's not buts. That's it. You'll wish you were dead. You seem a little disturbed, you wanna stay here?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No no, I want to go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cause if any of you would prefer to stay here, all you need to do is ring this bell. [holds up Taboo buzzer]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that the buzzer from Taboo?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: SHUT UP MAGGOT! YOU DON'T WANT TO GO, RING THE BELL! RING IT! Ring it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How many of you have seen the documentary Deliverance?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How did a mosquito get in here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I released three hundred mosquitoes in the conference room, just temporarily. When I'm done, the frogs will take care of the mosquitoes. [Frog in plastic cage ribbits]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, when he brushes your soft supple cheeks with his worn leathery hands and says "I'm gonna make you the seventh Mrs. Rosenblatt" unless you ring this bell. Ring it! Ring the bell. You wanna spend the rest of your life changing your husband's colostomy bags? Huh? Do you? Ring it! Wha-, [Jim slaps Dwight's forehead] oh. What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mosquito.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Sighs and grunts] Orientation is over.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Oh Darryl, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey what's up? You called?

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Yeah, you know I, I felt really terrible that you got me these lovely gloves and I didn't get you anything...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's cool really.

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: No, it's anything but cool. Now I haven't really had time to go out and buy you anything, but uh, here goes. [Hands Darryl pink slips of paper]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: "This coupon entitles you to one free tickle monster attack"

Quote.Speaker: Nate
Quote.Text: Yeah, they're Nate coupons. Or Nate-pons. And they're all different. Cash that one in and I will bring you a stick of gum, anytime, any place. I'll find you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thanks. [to Val] Nice flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Thanks, they're from my mom.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Your mom?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh. So I guess that was your mom who called me earlier looking for the address? Real deep voiced woman?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's her.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: She said her name was Brandon, I think. Your mom's name is Brandon?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: [laughs] Yeah Darryl, my mom's name is Brandon.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Then I guess I figured out where I stand. This is a love beanie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, Florida team, let's reconvene.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm going to Florida.....and I'm not coming back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So Sabre has set up a conference room for our use while we're at corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, what is this special project?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Basically Sabre has tasked us with helping them branch into the retail marketplace. They want to set up their own version of an Apple store.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That sounds awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It did, it did.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what might be great? Is if instead of a genius bar we have a lounge area where people can ask questions about the product with other customers who liked it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. And they should have a place where people can check their computers or printers before they see you so you don't have to carry it around like a dope. Like a coat check. [Dwight writes on whiteboard] Oh, don't write it down unless you like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I like it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It seems to me that the Apple store is kind of like a party. So I think our question is: How do we make this a better party?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. We sell business tools and the stores need to reflect that. They need to be all business. Let all the other stores look like a toy store.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Right. Think different, from Apple.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, is now a good time to go over what you expect of us?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [long pause] Yes. What are my expectations for the group?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have been given the responsibility to manage Stanley, a solid player, Ryan, who is capable of surprises, Erin, an excellent follower and Kathy, a probably not totally useless enigma. And, well, Jim. Under the right manager, that's not a bad team. Perfectinschlag.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know how I'm going to live here without you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Me neither. Hey, will you put this coat on my chair? I just realized I'm not going to need it down there.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes, I will take your coat. And I will keep it with me, and I will sleep with it because it smells like you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. Just put it on my chair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Alright [kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye. Call me when you land.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I will.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Safe travels.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Goodbye for a very very long time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, K. It's only three weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: [On phone] All expenses paid. Yeah, Jim's gonna be there. Their marriage is not good. Nobody knows better than me. Definitely we will. It's three weeks in Tallahassee, what else is there to do?
